Trump and Putin: A toxic and opaque relationship
description: For nearly 20 years, the US president has shown a clear fascination with his Russian counterpart, whom he is set to meet at a summit on Ukraine this Friday in Alaska. His real estate empire has benefited greatly from Russian private capital.

headline: Trump to meet Putin in high-stakes Alaska summit for Ukraine's future
Alaska, a hint of Russia in America
In Ukraine's Sloviansk and Kramatorsk, residents caught between hope and fear before Alaska summit
description: The Russian breakthrough in Ukraine's last strongholds in the eastern Donbas region has left residents anxious. As the Trump-Putin summit nears on Friday, one question remains: to stay or to go?

headline: France faces sharp decline in priestly vocations
description: The number of priests has fallen from 65,000 in 1960 to around 12,000 today. While recruiting foreign priests and merging parishes have eased the decline, the Catholic Church in France continues to grapple with how to address the phenomenon.

headline: Macron vows to punish 'hatred' after olive tree honoring Jewish victim is cut down
description: The olive tree was planted in memory of Ilan Halimi, a 23-year-old who was kidnapped and tortured to death in 2006. The Paris police chief announced the launch of an investigation.

headline: Trauma lingers in Greece, 10 years after austerity referendum
description: A decade after Greece rejected a third austerity package from its creditors, the economy has improved, but much of the population continues to struggle.

Who's going to lie down on the couch? 'The Sopranos,' the first TV series to tackle mental health
description: 'Breaking The Script' (3/5). In 1999, the TV series 'The Sopranos' introduced viewers to a mafia boss suffering from depression. Through the intense exchanges between this anti-hero and his therapist, mental health became a central theme on television for the first time, where it has continued to thrive ever since.

headline: Senegalese sailors on French fishing boats: 'They have the maritime spirit in their blood'
description: Over the past decade in Brittany, western France, fishing boat owners have been hiring crew members from Senegal, who are drawn to the region by wages higher than those paid in Spain.

headline: Hackers versus sports broadcasters: A tight match to win over viewers
description: 'Click To Pirate' (4/5). Hit later than other sectors by the scourge of piracy, the sports industry now faces a proliferation of illegal broadcasts, from Telegram to IPTV. Meanwhile, users of streaming platforms criticize what they see as inadequete legal offerings.
